newsitem.title: JAPAN: Konami's profit seen hitting record in 97/98-paper.
newsitem.headline: Konami's profit seen hitting record in 97/98-paper.

text.p: Japanese game software maker Konami Co Ltd is expected to post a record parent current profit of about nine billion yen in 1997/98, up 20 percent from the previous year, a Japanese business daily said on Friday.
The company's parent current profit this business year may surpass the previous record profit of 8.98 billion yen recorded in the 1989/90 business year, the Nihon Keizai Shimbun said.

A company spokesman declined to comment on the report, but said a strong business performance for the current business year to March 1998 was expected as the company planned to introduce more game titles for home-use game machines than in the previous business year.
The spokesman said the company plans to launch about 80 game titles in Japan and abroad in 1997/98, up 20 from 1996/97.
The paper said sales in 1997/98 are expected to reach about 68 billion yen, up 24 percent from the previous year.

In 1996/97, ended March, Konami is expected to have posted sales of 55 billion yen, up 28 percent from the previous year, and a parent current profit of 7.5 billion yen, more than twice that of the previous year.
